conclusion: Understanding the forces involved in the problem.
Net force acting on sled is zero due to constant speed.
Pulling force and frictional force are balanced.
Breaking pulling force into horizontal and vertical components.
Calculate horizontal component of pulling force: 80 N.
Calculate vertical component of pulling force: 60 N.
Consider forces in vertical direction: weight and normal force.
Calculate total weight of child and sled: 400 N downward.
Normal force plus vertical component of pulling force equals total weight.
Frictional force equals horizontal component of pulling force: 80 N.
Frictional force given by f = μ * N.
Calculate coefficient of kinetic friction: μ ≈ 0.235.
Pressure is force per unit area: P = F/A.
Pressure exerted by sled is normal force divided by area.
Pressure might be total downward force per unit area.
Re-evaluate forces: weight is downward, normal force is upward.
Normal force equals weight minus vertical component of pulling force.
